{"step_by_step_thinking": "The description of a well-defined annular lesion with central scarring that has been gradually progressive over several months is suggestive of a chronic skin condition. Annular psoriasis typically presents with red, scaly patches and is not usually associated with central scarring. Lupus Vulgaris is a form of cutaneous tuberculosis and could present with such a lesion, but it is relatively rare. Tinea Corporis, or ringworm, is a fungal infection that often presents as a well-defined, annular lesion and can cause scarring if left untreated for a long period of time. Chronic granulomatous disease is a rare, genetic disorder that affects the immune system and typically presents with recurrent infections, not skin lesions.", "answer_choice": "C. Tinea Corporis"}
